etymologies: late 17th century; earliest use found in Martin Lister (bap. 1639, d. 1712), physician and naturalist. From red + ware

definitions: Any of various kinds of pottery made from red clay or given a red colour in firing; especially (a) boccaro as imported into Europe from China in the 17th century, or European stoneware made in imitation of this; (b) a kind of coarse pottery made from red clay which fires at a low temperature.
